    • Method Detail

      • newDirectPool

        @Nonnull
public static ExecutorService newDirectPool()
        Creates a new ExecutorService that runs each task in the thread that invokes execute/submit. This applies both to individually submitted tasks and to collections of tasks submitted via invokeAll or invokeAny. In the latter case, tasks will run serially on the calling thread. Tasks are run to completion before a Future is returned to the caller (unless the executor has been shutdown).

        Although all tasks are immediately executed in the thread that submitted the task, this ExecutorService imposes a small locking overhead on each task submission in order to implement shutdown and termination behavior.

        Returns:
        a new service

      • newFixedThreadPool

        @Nonnull
public static ExecutorService newFixedThreadPool()
        Creates a new ExecutorService using the maximum available processors, that will be closed when the application will exit.
        Returns:
        a new service
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if nThreads <= 0
        See Also:
        newFixedThreadPool(int)

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown(ExecutorService service,
                            long timeout,
                            TimeUnit unit,
                            boolean executeUnstarted)
        Cleanly closes the service.
        Parameters:
        service - the service to close
        timeout - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument
        executeUnstarted - true if the remaining tasks must be executed synchronously if they have not completed their execution after the shutdown request
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if timeout < 0
        See Also:
        ExecutorService.shutdown(), ExecutorService.awaitTermination(long, TimeUnit), ExecutorService.shutdownNow()

      • shutdown

        @Nonnull
public static List<Runnable> shutdown(ExecutorService service,
                                               long timeout,
                                               TimeUnit unit)
        Cleanly closes the service.
        Parameters:
        service - the service to close
        timeout - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument
        Returns:
        a list of remaining tasks that never commenced execution
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if timeout < 0
        See Also:
        ExecutorService.shutdown(), ExecutorService.awaitTermination(long, TimeUnit), ExecutorService.shutdownNow()

      • shutdownAtExit

        @Nonnull
public static ExecutorService shutdownAtExit(ExecutorService service,
                                                      long timeout,
                                                      TimeUnit unit,
                                                      boolean executeUnstarted)
        Adds a shutdown hook to cleanly closes the service when the application will exit.
        Parameters:
        service - the service to close
        timeout - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument
        executeUnstarted - true if the remaining tasks must be executed synchronously if they have not completed their execution after the shutdown request
        Returns:
        the service
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any argument is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if timeout < 0
        See Also:
        ExecutorService.shutdown(), ExecutorService.awaitTermination(long, TimeUnit), ExecutorService.shutdownNow()
